parsed.internal_thinking: I have successfully placed my second settlement at Node 31, which gives me access to Wood (11), Brick (10), and Wheat (9). This complements my first settlement at Node 42, which provides Ore (5, 2) and Wheat (9). My goal now is to connect these two settlements to create a strong, unified foundation. My first road was placed between Node 42 and Node 41. By placing this second road between Node 31 and Node 41, I will fully connect my two settlements at the very start of the game. This not only puts me in a great position for the Longest Road later but also secures the path to the Wood 2:1 port at Node 40, which I can reach with just one more road. This connection is the most strategically sound move to ensure mobility and resource flow between my production hubs. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Settlements 31 and 42 are now connected via Node 41. I have strong Wheat, Ore, Wood, and Brick production. My immediate weakness is Sheep. I should look to expand toward Node 19 or Node 30/29 area if Sheep becomes available, or prioritize getting to a port to trade my surplus Wheat and Wood.
parsed.say_outloud: Connecting my settlements early seems like the best way to keep my options open. I'm really liking this setup—it gives me a bit of everything I need to start building, and having a direct link between my two sites should make expansion much smoother. Good luck with the first official turn, everyone!
